sub_title: Partnership & Portfolio Coordinator at The Netherlands Red Cross

education.field_of_study: Dutch, English, German, Latin, Greek, History, Mathematics A and General Economics

courses.name: Needs Assessment in Emergency & Rehabilitation Situations / NGO Management School Geneva (2 ects)
Project Cycle Management / NGO Management School Geneva (2 ects)
Talent Development Programme / Management Centre De Baak

profile_positions.description: As Partnership & Portfolio Coordinator I am responsible for the development and implementation of the partnership strategy and management of our bilateral project portfolio in Lebanon, the Palestinian territories and the Philippines. In dialogue and close collaboration with the Lebanese Red Cross (LRCS), Palestine Red Crescent (PRCS) and Philippine Red Cross (PRC), the strategic direction of our long-term partnerships is developed, monitored and implemented; guiding the development of our joint project portfolio. LRCS, PRCS and PRC implement our joint strategy and bilateral projects in close coordination with our delegates in the field, supported from HQ by myself and the Portfolio Officer for Lebanon, the Palestinian territories and the Philippines (the desk). In support of our team in the field the desk liaises with HR, finance, procurement, communication, technical advisors, security officer, PMER and other supporting departments at HQ.
profile_positions.title: Partnership & Portfolio Coordinator

profile_positions.description: Responsible for managing relations between the Netherlands Red Cross and Postcode Lottery: day to day contact and cooperation with the lottery, identifying projects and partners, developing and submitting extra project and dream fund proposals, coordinating project implementation with internal and external partners, preparing and submitting yearly and final narrative and financial reports. Preparing and coordinating all communication activities about and with the Postcode Lottery, e.g. the preparation of two ‘Kanjers van Goud’ productions with Endemol (Mongolia 2012, NL 2016). In addition to my role as relationship manager I manage several projects in the field of marketing and fundraising: e.g. developing, editing and maintaining a portfolio of national and international projects to facilitate the work of our fundraising team. I was also responsible for preparing and coordinating the launch of the Red Cross Princess Margriet Fund for disaster risk reduction in September 2011 in cooperation with Niehe Media in Royal Theatre Carré.
profile_positions.title: Sr. Project manager and relationship manager

profile_positions.description: With a team of four colleagues I was responsible for organising all internal and external meetings and events of the Netherlands Red Cross: e.g. a National Volunteer Day for ca. 5000 volunteers on 8 May 2010. I was responsible for the production of this event, from developing the programme to managing the budget and the overall coordination on the day itself, working together with a range of internal and external partners; a project team of volunteers and professionals, Ministry of Defence, catering, performing artists, technicians etc. Another event we organised together with a project team of colleagues was ‘Nederland helpt Japan’ in Amsterdam Arena in 2011. I was also contact person for the Humanity House, participating in the programming steering group.
profile_positions.title: Manager Project bureau

profile_positions.description: In this position I was co-author of an evaluation and recommendation document on the implementation of the 3-year Youth & Diversity Programme of The Netherlands Cross. An important element of the evaluation process was conducting and analysing interviews with volunteers and staff in all levels of the organisation.
profile_positions.title: Advisor Youth & Diversity

profile_positions.description: At the Red Cross/EU Office I was responsible for developing and coordinating a joint campaign of the 27 EU Red Cross Societies (EUNS) on promoting respect for diversity and non-discrimination, working together with a Steering Group of representatives of 6 National Societies. As manager of the campaign I organised regular coordination meetings of the Steering Group and for several meetings with all participating EUNS and the IFRC. To gather knowledge and establish an internal and external network, I made field visits to National Societies and participated in several EU conferences. I managed to get 25 of the 27 EUNS plus the Norwegian and Swiss Red Cross on board.
profile_positions.title: Desk officer Non-discrimination and Promotion of Humanitarian Values

profile_positions.description: As Project Manager Youth I was responsible for developing and carrying out internal and external projects to involve more young people in the work of the Red Cross; e.g. setting up and maintaining a network of 500 young Red Cross ambassadors and laying the foundations for the Student desks.  In this position I twice replaced the Manager of the Youth & Diversity Desk during her maternity leave, managing the desk and its team of three colleagues.
profile_positions.title: Project manager Youth

profile_positions.description: As Project Manager CCI I developed and executed a project to stimulate and support local Red Cross branches in setting up projects and partnerships with companies.
profile_positions.title: Project manager Corporate Community Involvement (CCI)
